definition: lit. as drunk as mud/completely drunk
soft/mushy/well-cooked and soft/to rot/to decompose/rotten/worn out/chaotic/messy/utterly/thoroughly/crappy/bad
intoxicated
as/as if/such as
mud/clay/paste/pulp
restrained

sentences.english: He nodded out home last night.
sentences.chinese: 他昨晚回家時已爛醉如泥。

sentences.english: He is dead drunk. He's been drinking with his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他爛醉如泥，他剛纔一直在和朋友們喝酒。

sentences.english: Well, okay, I still get stoned.
He came home totally rat-arsed last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上他回到家的時候已完全爛醉如泥。

sentences.english: They staggered out of the pub, completely drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他們爛醉如泥，踉踉倉倉的走出酒館。

sentences.english: Drew: Well, you could say, I feel really rotten.
sentences.chinese: 那，你還可以說，我喝得爛醉如泥。

sentences.english: He got absolutely sozzled at the Christmas party.
sentences.chinese: 他在聖誕節聚會上爛醉如泥。

sentences.english: A peck of pickled peppers Peter Piper picked.
sentences.chinese: 啄爛醉如泥的胡椒彼得吹笛者被選。

sentences.english: After 20 beers steve really got blitzed (out) last night .
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫昨夜喝了20杯啤酒，爛醉如泥。

sentences.english: Fatima: You're stinking drunk and this date is over. Capisce?
sentences.chinese: 你已經爛醉如泥了，約會結束了，明白嗎？

sentences.english: He was dead drunk in the New Year Eve party.
sentences.chinese: 他在除夕晚會上喝得爛醉如泥。

sentences.english: He was really poleaxed last night.
Dogs never smoke or drink under the table.
sentences.chinese: 狗不抽菸或喝得爛醉如泥。

definition: to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
to whisper to one another's ear
needlework/sewing
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
from the start/absolutely/entirely/simply
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
men and women should not touch hands when they give or receive things (citation, from Mencius)
pinyin: nan2 nu:3 shou4 shou4 bu4 qin1

definition: listless/dispirited/washed out/also written 沒精打彩|没精打彩
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
willingly and gladly (idiom)
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
livor mortis
foolish talk/nonsense
hiding place/hideout
